name: sherpa

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: cxxstd
variants.description: Use the specified C++ standard when building

variants.name: lhole
variants.description: Enable Les Houches One-Loop Generator interface

variants.name: libs
variants.description: Build shared libs, static libs or both

variants.name: cms
variants.description: Append CXXFLAGS used by CMS experiment

description:
Sherpa is a Monte Carlo event generator for the Simulation of High-
Energy Reactions of PArticles in lepton-lepton, lepton-photon, photon-
photon, lepton-hadron and hadron-hadron collisions.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: texinfo
dependencies.description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: There can only be one (MPI process)!

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: swig
dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.

dependencies.name: hepmc
dependencies.description:
The HepMC package is an object oriented, C++ event record for High
Energy Physics Monte Carlo generators and simulation.

dependencies.name: hepmc3
dependencies.description:
The HepMC package is an object oriented, C++ event record for High
Energy Physics Monte Carlo generators and simulation.

dependencies.name: rivet
dependencies.description: Rivet - the particle-physics MC analysis toolkit

dependencies.name: fastjet
dependencies.description:
A high energy physics software package for jet finding in pp and e+e-
collisions.

dependencies.name: openloops
dependencies.description:
The OpenLoops 2 program is a fully automated implementation of the Open
Loops algorithm combined with on-the-fly reduction methods, which allows
for the fast and stable numerical evaluation of tree and one-loop matrix
elements for any Standard Model process at NLO QCD and NLO EW.

dependencies.name: recola
dependencies.description:
REcursive Computation of One-Loop Amplitudes: a fortran library for the
perturbative computation of next-to-leading-order transition amplitudes
in the Standard Model of particle physics.

dependencies.name: root
dependencies.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependencies.name: lhapdf
dependencies.description:
LHAPDF is a general purpose C++ interpolator, used for evaluating PDFs
from discretised data files.

dependencies.name: gzip
dependencies.description:
GNU Gzip is a popular data compression program originally written by
Jean-loup Gailly for the GNU project.

dependencies.name: pythia6
dependencies.description:
PYTHIA is a program for the generation of high-energy physics events,
i.e. for the description of collisions at high energies between
elementary particles such as e+, e-, p and pbar in various combinations.
PYTHIA6 is a Fortran package which is no longer maintained: new
prospective users should use Pythia8 instead. This recipe includes
patches required to interoperate with Root.

dependencies.name: blackhat
dependencies.description: Blackhat MC generator

dependencies.name: hztool
dependencies.description:
HZTool is a library of routines which will allow you to reproduce an
experimental result using the four-vector final state from Monte Carlo
generators.
